availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer. Boyle County, Kentucky, native. Married to Amanda Owsley Rodes in Garrard County, Kentucky, on December 19, 1823. Father of Ann Rodes, Americus R. Rodes, Clifton Rodes Jr., Boyle O. Rodes, Amanda R. Rodes, Amelia A. Rodes, Sally R. Rodes, and Charles Henry Rodes. Farmer in Boyle County in 1850. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Danville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District No. 2, p. 769B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District No. 2, p. 584.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 843A-B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #23227.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Garrard County Marriages, Film #000183256.
"Clifton Rodes (1798-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #40314983, accessed August 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/40314983.
